backend/main.mo: Main actor defining SurgeryCase types, user profiles, OpenAI config, and CRUD operations for cases with access control via MixinAuthorization; includes migration support and permission checks on all endpoints.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that transforms old actor state (with basic OpenAIConfig) to new state (with initialized flag), preserving cases and nextId while upgrading the config structure.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting three features related to fixing backend actor initialization issues, adding error boundaries with retry mechanisms, and ensuring CaseFormDialog waits for actor availability.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend TypeScript/React components including App.tsx, hooks, auth components, case management views, forms, CSV import/export, and validation logic with actor availability checks.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes defining colors for UI components, charts, sidebar, and design tokens using oklch color space.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with PWA manifest links, favicons, theme color configuration, and forced light color scheme for the Surgery Case Log application.
frontend/public/manifest.json: PWA manifest defining app metadata, icons, display mode (standalone), theme colors, and categorization for the Surgery Case Log application.
frontend/public/sw.js: Service worker implementing cache-first strategy for static assets, precaching app shell on install, cleaning old caches on activate, and skipping caching for Internet Identity and API calls.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root component managing authentication flow, actor availability checks with loading states and retry mechanism, profile setup modal, view switching between cases and settings, and forced light theme enforcement.
frontend/src/features/auth/components/Lo: Login/logout button component that uses Internet Identity for authentication and clears the query cache on logout.
frontend/src/features/auth/components/Pr: Modal dialog that prompts new users to enter their name and saves it to their profile using the useSaveCallerUserProfile hook.
frontend/src/features/cases/checklist.ts: Defines checklist items (discharge notes, labs, imaging, etc.) with utilities to get default checklist state, remaining items, and task counts.
frontend/src/features/cases/components/C: Displays a surgery case as a card with patient details, remaining checklist tasks, and actions to edit, delete, or toggle task completion.
Dialog form for creating or editing surgery cases with fields for patient/owner info, AI-powered structured text parsing, MRN-based auto-prefill, and checklist editing.
Main view component that displays all surgery cases with search, sort, species/task filters, and CSV import/export functionality.
Search input component with icon for filtering cases by any field.
Dropdown select component for choosing case sort order using predefined sort options.
Popover filter component with checkboxes for filtering cases by species, persisting selections to session storage.
A popover filter component that allows users to select checklist task types to filter surgery cases by incomplete tasks, with session storage persistence and an active filter count badge.
A form component that renders checkboxes for all checklist items (discharge notes, labs, imaging, histo, culture, surgery report, PDVM notified) with optional disabled state.
A component providing CSV export and import functionality for surgery cases, with progress tracking, error display, and backend synchronization via create/update mutations.
frontend/src/features/cases/components/D: A date input component combining a text field (MM/DD/YYYY format) with a calendar popover picker for flexible date entry.
Implements CSV export and import logic for surgery cases, including date/enum formatting, field escaping, row parsing, validation, and matching with existing cases by medical record number.
frontend/src/features/cases/csv/caseCsvS: Defines the 17-column CSV schema for surgery case import/export with header names, type definitions, validation constants, and documentation for date/boolean/enum formats.
frontend/src/features/cases/filtering.ts: Provides filtering functions for surgery cases by species and incomplete task types, plus a combined filter/sort pipeline function.
frontend/src/features/cases/parsing/pars: Preprocesses raw OCR text by normalizing whitespace, correcting common character recognition errors (O/0, I/1/l), removing artifacts, and cleaning punctuation.

Parses semi-structured text in label:value format to extract case information fields (MRN, pet name, dates, species, etc.) and returns a partial CaseFormData object, serving as a fallback for AI responses and Quick Fill feature.
frontend/src/features/cases/search.ts: Implements case search functionality that filters surgery cases by matching query strings against text fields, species/sex labels, dates, and checklist item names.
frontend/src/features/cases/services/aiI: Empty file placeholder for AI image analysis service functionality.
frontend/src/features/cases/sorting.ts: Provides sorting functionality for surgery cases with four options: arrival date (newest/oldest) and open tasks count (most/fewest), with secondary sorting by arrival date for stability.
frontend/src/features/cases/types.ts: Defines TypeScript types and constants for case form data, including species options (canine/feline/other) and sex options (male/female with neutered/spayed variants).
frontend/src/features/cases/validation.t: Provides validation and parsing functions for case form fields including required field validation, species/sex parsing with flexible string matching, and date parsing supporting multiple formats (M/D/YYYY, ISO, etc.).
frontend/src/features/settings/component: React component for the settings page that allows users to configure and save their OpenAI API key, displaying validation status and providing secure input with show/hide toggle.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance based on Internet Identity authentication state, automatically invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useDebouncedValue.ts: Custom React hook that debounces a changing value with configurable delay (default 500ms) using setTimeout cleanup pattern.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and AuthClient lifecycle with configurable options for idle handling and derivation origin.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for user profiles, admin checks, OpenAI configuration, and surgery case management, all using the actor from useActor hook with proper loading states and cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables defining a light blue color scheme using OKLCH color space, including specific colors for patient names and presenting complaints.
frontend/src/lib/utils.ts: Utility function that combines clsx and tailwind-merge for conditional CSS class name composition.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query client and Internet Identity provider, then renders the App component.
frontend/src/types/tesseract.d.ts: TypeScript type definitions for the Tesseract.js OCR library, including worker options, recognition results, and text extraction data structures.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting URL parameters from both regular query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence support for maintaining state across navigation.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom theme extensions for colors using OKLCH format, container settings, animations, and typography/container-queries plugins.
project_state.json: Project metadata tracking known issues with backend actor initialization preventing case addition, existing features for error handling, and pending feature requests for actor recreation on authentication changes.
